actions.committee: Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources, S. Rept. 95-520.
Placed on calendar in Senate under Measures Cleared to be Considered by Unanimous Consent.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Reported to House from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1492.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.

official_title: A bill to modify the boundary of the White River National Forest in the State of Colorado.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1492) Modifies the boundary of the White River National Forest to include approximately 2,416 acres near Aspen, Colorado, and approximately 71,436 acres near Minturn, Colorado. Stipulates that nothing in this Act shall affect the validity or term of any existing right-or-way, license or lease applications filed under the Unintentional Trepass Act, or easement covering lands transferred by this Act. Provides that existing grazing authorization covering the transferred lands are to remain in effect until March 1, 1980, at which time the holders may apply to the Forest Service for a new authorization. Provides that, subject to existing rights, all lands owned by the United States in the areas desribed are added to the White River National Forest, and shall be administered in accordance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations. States that the boundary of the White River National Forest shall be treated as if it were the boundary on January 1, 1965, to permit Land and Water Fund moneys to be used for eligible acquisitions.

titles.title: A bill to modify the boundary of the White River National Forest in the State of Colorado.
